source: Some of the respondents have been tagged as belonging to group 1 – 6. However, due to a data calculation issue, some of the respondents have had their groups (pov6) missing. Build a model that will classify these respondents back into one of the 6 groups. a. Please explain the choice of metric / evaluation criterion used b. What are the assumptions you made when building this model?

# import the libraries 
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
import seaborn as sns 
import pandas as pd

# Check summary of the data 

data.describe().T

# check for duplicates 

print("Nos of Duplicate",data.duplicated().sum())

#var 9 is having categorical value which we need to convert to numerical
#remove respondent.id and year ,t.158

data_new = data.drop(["year","respondent.id","t.158"],axis=1,inplace=True)

# fill the missing values with mean 
for column in data.columns:
    mean = data[column].mean()
    data[column]=data[column].fillna(mean)

source: # check the missing values post filling the values using mean

# There are 6 dependent variables and multiple independent variable 
# we are going to use Multinomial Logistic Regression model 
# drop the pov6 column to make train data set 

x = data.drop("pov6",axis=1)

from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import confusion_matrix,classification_report
model = LogisticRegression(multi_class="multinomial",solver='newton-cg',max_iter = 100,n_jobs=-1,warm_start=bool)
